content: Choose a venue. [1] Unless you’re having your entire party at home, you’ll want to have a great winter-friendly place to celebrate. Depending upon where you live, you have a variety of options for places to host your birthday party. When choosing your venue, keep your budget and number of party guests in mind. Possible winter party venues include: A bowling alley An arcade A restaurant A movie theatre A dance studio An indoor pool A studio with classes (e.g. ceramics painting or dancing) An indoor or outdoor ice-skating rink A local museum that hosts parties Plan activities based around your party theme. [2] A great way to get inspiration for winter birthday party activities is to think first about what you want your theme to be. Then, you can think of activities that go well with your theme. Some examples of themes with corresponding activities include: “Art Party”: Create drawings, paintings, and sculptures. You can even host a contest, choose judges, and have small prizes for the winners. Consider also making something the party guest will use, like a painted tote bag or t-shirt. “Nostalgic Disney Party”: Every one loves remember their favorite classic Disney movies. Play Disney Scene It! and trivia, and marathon watch old Disney movies. “Winter Wonderland”: If you live somewhere snowy, take advantage of it. Go sledding and have a snowman-building contest. You can even try to build a fort from snow. Just make sure all your guests bring their snow gear. “Baking Party”: Use premade cakes or cookies, and let everyone decorate their own with icing, fondant, and sprinkles. Watch shows like Cake Boss to inspire your sweet creations. “Dance Competition”: Put on some music, and see who can come up with the best moves. Play dancing games on your Xbox or Wii, if you have one, to make it a bit more structured. Watch and comment on dancing shows like Dance Moms, So You Think You Can Dance, or Dancing with the Stars, when you get tired of dancing yourself. “Indoor Scavenger Hunt”: Scavenger hunts are fun and versatile. Make clues in advance and hide them around the party venue. Break guests up into teams. See who can follow the clues to the hidden prize first. “Dreaming of Summer”: Having a sunny indoor party when it’s cold and gray can be a lot of fun. Have beach chairs for your guests to sit on, and let everyone wear flower necklaces. Play summery music, like Jimmy Buffet or the Beach Boys. Turn up the heat, and tell everyone to bring beach clothes. Watch a classic surf movie. “Spa Party”: Throw a spa party, and pamper all your guests. Do each other’s nails and hair. Make homemade face masks. [3] Light scented candle. Give everyone a gift bag with make up or a sleep mask. “Murder Mystery”: Having a murder mystery party can be a great way to make your entire party into a game. [4] You can buy a premade game, download a free one, or make up your own. Give all your guests a character, and send them a small description of that character before the party. Tell them to dress up like the character. Throughout the party, as your characters, you and your guests will have to ask each other questions to determine who the murderer is. Create a bonfire party. Having a roaring fire is a great way to have an outdoor party even during winter. Pick a spot in your backyard to have your fire, and set up camp chairs around it for your guests. You can roast marshmallows and hot dogs in the fire. Keep safety in mind. [5] After you build your fire, make sure your have sand and water on hand to put it out once the party is over. Keep a stack of wood handy to stoke the fire during the party. Provide blankets. Even though you’ll have a fire, it can be nice to have a bunch of wool blankets on hand to keep your guests comfortable. If you don’t have enough blankets, ask the party guests to bring their own. If you know someone who plays guitar, ask them to bring their guitar so they can play songs around the fire. Create your own cinema. [6] No matter the theme of your party, you can always find a related movie or TV show to watch. This gives everyone a chance to relax. Creating a cinema experience makes watching a movie feel more like a party. Hang up a white sheet on an empty wall. Borrow a projector to project a movie up onto the sheet, as an inexpensive movie screen. Cozy up the movie area with lots of pillows and blankets. If you live in an area with mild winters, you can even have an outdoor movie, complete with lots of blankets and maybe even a campfire. Make popcorn, and serve boxed candy, just like the movie theatre. Let everyone know what movie you’re showing when you invite them to the party. Have a marathon. Consider making a night of it, and watching all the movies in a series. Play board games. [7] Board games are a great option for any home party. They are inexpensive, and provide hours of entertainment. You can even have prizes for the winners. Play classic board games like Monopoly, Sorry, Life or Risk. Choose more interactive, creative board games like Balderdash or Cranium. When choosing board games, make sure you choose games that all your guests can play at once, or have different game stations. Consider also playing party games like Never Have I Ever, Musical Chairs, Charades, or Two Truths and a Lie along with your board games. Many games like this also have board game versions. [8] Decide how many people to invite. [9] [10] When you begin to plan your birthday party, you want to start thinking of who you’d like to invite and how many people will be your limit. Don’t feel obligated to invite people you don’t know very well. You want to feel comfortable, and it’s okay to only invite your close friends to your party. Sometimes fewer people is better. Think about the amount of space you have and how many people can comfortably fit. Also, take into account whether you’ll be driving anywhere and whether or not you want to have a sleepover. Anywhere between 5 and 15 people is normal for a teenage birthday party, but the number is ultimately up to you. You might only be comfortable with having your two best friends over, or you might have 20 people you really want to invite. Ask your parents what they are comfortable accommodating. Pick a length of time for your party. Giving your party a time helps your guests know what to expect. Also, how long the party will last will determine how much food you need and how many guests you want to invite. Try to have your party on a weekend so that more people will be able to come. If your party is a sleepover, think about when you want your guests to arrive and when you’d like them to leave the next day. Consider your activities. For example, if you want to have a bonfire, you want your party to occur in the evening when it’s getting dark. Pick a party theme. [11] Having a theme can help you plan your invitations, decorations, and food. For a winter party, your theme might just be a winter wonderland. You could plan to decorate with snowflakes and have cozy, comfort foods. Other possible wintertime themes could be: A camping and bonfire theme A movie-based theme (e.g. Harry Potter) A combined birthday and holiday party A sports watching party (e.g. hockey) Make and send party invitations. [12] Invitations are fun way to make your party feel more special and build the anticipation. You can use programs like Microsoft Word or PowerPoint to make your own invitations, hand write your invitations, or buy premade invitations. Either mail your invitations, or give them to your friends in person. Make sure the invitations include the date and time of the party, the location of the party, and how the guest can RSVP. Also include if the guests needs to bring anything. For example, if it’s a sleepover, let them know if they should bring a blanket or pillow. If you don’t want to send physical invitations, you can use Facebook to make an event for your party. [13] All your friends can RSVP through the event page and ask you questions about the party. Decorate for your winter birthday party. [14] Even if you don’t want to go all out, a little bit of decoration can make your party feel festive and thought-out. Pick a few colors to based your decorations around. For example, if your party has a seasonal winter theme, silver, white, and blue are good colors to decorate with. Get a tablecloth for the table you’ll put food on, and get some balloons for the main party room. You can also add streamers or tinsel. Make a birthday banner with some ribbon, cardstock, and a marker. [15] Before the party, it can be fun to invite over one or two of your close friends to help you decorate and set up. Serve warm drinks. A winter party is the ideal time to have warm comfort foods and drinks. Hot chocolate can be a great winter party beverage that most people enjoy. To make it more festive, have a hot chocolate bar. [16] On a table, set up hot chocolate with plenty of toppings for your guests to choose from. You can have whipped cream, chocolate chips, sprinkles, crushed cookies, and peppermint stirring sticks. In addition to hot chocolate, you can also serve warm apple cider. Set your drinks out with an assortment of mugs for your guests to choose from. Make finger foods. [17] Whether or not your party falls around a meal time, it’s good to have snack types foods. Pizza is a great finger food that can be a meal or a snack. You can also serve breadsticks or pizza dough pretzels in addition. Serve different kinds of dips, like onion dip or hummus, with chips and pretzels. For a healthier snack, set out cut fruit and vegetables on a platter. Create a buildable dish. This allows your guests with various dietary preferences or allergies to all find something that they like. For example, nachos are a great party dish. You can serve all the topping in bowls along a table, and allow your guests to build their own. Other dishes like this include: Salads Sandwiches Burgers and vegetable burgers Rice bowls Tacos Personal pizza Spaghetti Consider the cake. For your birthday, you’ll want to have some type of sweet confection to celebrate with. You can go with a traditional decorated cake or cupcakes, or you can choose another type of dessert. [18] Some alternatives to traditional cake include: Cheesecake Ice cream cake A cake made from donuts A cookie cake or platter Pie Brownies
title_html: How to Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens)

<h1 class="firstHeading no_toc"><a href="https://www.wikihow.com/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)">How to Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens)</a></h1>
<div class="ss_check" id="expert_coauthor">
	
	Co-authored by <a class="staff_icon expert_coauthor_link" href="#article_info_section">
		wikiHow Staff</a> <span class="ss_pipe">|</span><a href="#references">18 References</a>
</div>
<p class="vertical_toc" id="method_toc">
<span class="header_toc">Explore this Article</span>

<p>Your teenage birthday party should be full of friends, good food, and great activities. Even though your birthday is in the winter, you still have plenty of options for your birthday. Create fun indoor activities or plan winter outdoor activities like sledding or gathering around a bonfire.</p>

<a class="anchor" name="Planning_Fun_Winter_Birthday_Party_Activities_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky steps_first">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>1</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Planning_Fun_Winter_Birthday_Party_Activities">Planning Fun Winter Birthday Party Activities</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_1">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-1-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-1-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_1b6b04d682" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_1b6b04d682')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 1" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" onload="WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-1-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript>
<script>WH.performance.clearMarks('image1_rendered'); WH.performance.mark('image1_rendered');</script></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Choose a venue.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 1" class="reference" id="_ref-1"><a href="#_note-1">[1]</a></sup> Unless you’re having your entire party at home, you’ll want to have a great winter-friendly place to celebrate. Depending upon where you live, you have a variety of options for places to host your birthday party. When choosing your venue, keep your budget and number of party guests in mind. Possible winter party venues include:

<ul>
<li>A bowling alley</li>
<li>An arcade</li>
<li>A restaurant</li>
<li>A movie theatre</li>
<li>A dance studio</li>
<li>An indoor pool</li>
<li>A studio with classes (e.g. ceramics painting or dancing)</li>
<li>An indoor or outdoor ice-skating rink</li>
<li>A local museum that hosts parties</li>
</ul>
<script>WH.performance.mark('step1_rendered');</script>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-2-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-2-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_2ba3c3aae4" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_2ba3c3aae4')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 2" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-2-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Plan activities based around your party theme.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 2" class="reference" id="_ref-2"><a href="#_note-2">[2]</a></sup> A great way to get inspiration for winter birthday party activities is to think first about what you want your theme to be. Then, you can think of activities that go well with your theme. Some examples of themes with corresponding activities include:

<ul>
<li>“Art Party”: Create drawings, paintings, and sculptures. You can even host a contest, choose judges, and have small prizes for the winners. Consider also making something the party guest will use, like a painted tote bag or t-shirt.</li>
<li>“Nostalgic Disney Party”: Every one loves remember their favorite classic Disney movies. Play Disney Scene It! and trivia, and marathon watch old Disney movies.</li>
<li>“Winter Wonderland”: If you live somewhere snowy, take advantage of it. Go sledding and have a snowman-building contest. You can even try to build a fort from snow. Just make sure all your guests bring their snow gear.</li>
<li>“Baking Party”: Use premade cakes or cookies, and let everyone decorate their own with icing, fondant, and sprinkles. Watch shows like Cake Boss to inspire your sweet creations.</li>
<li>“Dance Competition”: Put on some music, and see who can come up with the best moves. Play dancing games on your Xbox or Wii, if you have one, to make it a bit more structured. Watch and comment on dancing shows like Dance Moms, So You Think You Can Dance, or Dancing with the Stars, when you get tired of dancing yourself.</li>
<li>“Indoor Scavenger Hunt”: Scavenger hunts are fun and versatile. Make clues in advance and hide them around the party venue. Break guests up into teams. See who can follow the clues to the hidden prize first.</li>
<li>“Dreaming of Summer”: Having a sunny indoor party when it’s cold and gray can be a lot of fun. Have beach chairs for your guests to sit on, and let everyone wear flower necklaces. Play summery music, like Jimmy Buffet or the Beach Boys. Turn up the heat, and tell everyone to bring beach clothes. Watch a classic surf movie.</li>
<li>“Spa Party”: Throw a spa party, and pamper all your guests. Do each other’s nails and hair. Make homemade face masks.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 3" class="reference" id="_ref-3"><a href="#_note-3">[3]</a></sup> Light scented candle. Give everyone a gift bag with make up or a sleep mask.</li>
<li>“Murder Mystery”: Having a murder mystery party can be a great way to make your entire party into a game.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 4" class="reference" id="_ref-4"><a href="#_note-4">[4]</a></sup> You can buy a premade game, download a free one, or make up your own. Give all your guests a character, and send them a small description of that character before the party. Tell them to dress up like the character. Throughout the party, as your characters, you and your guests will have to ask each other questions to determine who the murderer is.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-3-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-3-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_44f38222fd" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_44f38222fd')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 3" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-3-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Create a bonfire party.</b> Having a roaring fire is a great way to have an outdoor party even during winter. Pick a spot in your backyard to have your fire, and set up camp chairs around it for your guests. You can roast marshmallows and hot dogs in the fire.

<ul>
<li>Keep safety in mind.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 5" class="reference" id="_ref-5"><a href="#_note-5">[5]</a></sup> After you build your fire, make sure your have sand and water on hand to put it out once the party is over.</li>
<li>Keep a stack of wood handy to stoke the fire during the party.</li>
<li>Provide blankets. Even though you’ll have a fire, it can be nice to have a bunch of wool blankets on hand to keep your guests comfortable. If you don’t have enough blankets, ask the party guests to bring their own.</li>
<li>If you know someone who plays guitar, ask them to bring their guitar so they can play songs around the fire.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-4-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-4-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_73b4333821" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_73b4333821')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 4" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-4-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Create your own cinema.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 6" class="reference" id="_ref-6"><a href="#_note-6">[6]</a></sup> No matter the theme of your party, you can always find a related movie or TV show to watch. This gives everyone a chance to relax. Creating a cinema experience makes watching a movie feel more like a party.

<ul>
<li>Hang up a white sheet on an empty wall. Borrow a projector to project a movie up onto the sheet, as an inexpensive movie screen. Cozy up the movie area with lots of pillows and blankets. If you live in an area with mild winters, you can even have an outdoor movie, complete with lots of blankets and maybe even a campfire.</li>
<li>Make popcorn, and serve boxed candy, just like the movie theatre. Let everyone know what movie you’re showing when you invite them to the party.</li>
<li>Have a marathon. Consider making a night of it, and watching all the movies in a series.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-5-Version-2.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-5-Version-2.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" height="546" id="img_fe605dd705" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fe605dd705')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 5" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-5-Version-2.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_1_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Play board games.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 7" class="reference" id="_ref-7"><a href="#_note-7">[7]</a></sup> Board games are a great option for any home party. They are inexpensive, and provide hours of entertainment. You can even have prizes for the winners.

<ul>
<li>Play classic board games like Monopoly, Sorry, Life or Risk.</li>
<li>Choose more interactive, creative board games like Balderdash or Cranium.</li>
<li>When choosing board games, make sure you choose games that all your guests can play at once, or have different game stations.</li>
<li>Consider also playing party games like Never Have I Ever, Musical Chairs, Charades, or Two Truths and a Lie along with your board games. Many games like this also have board game versions.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 8" class="reference" id="_ref-8"><a href="#_note-8">[8]</a></sup>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>

<div class="clearall adclear"></div>
<script>WH.desktopAds.addBodyAd('methodad')</script>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>
<a class="anchor" name="Setting_Up_a_Winter_Party_at_Home_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>2</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Setting_Up_a_Winter_Party_at_Home">Setting Up a Winter Party at Home</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_2">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-6.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-6.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-6.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-6.jpg" height="546" id="img_f453ec62b6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_f453ec62b6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 6" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-6.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-6.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Decide how many people to invite.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 9" class="reference" id="_ref-9"><a href="#_note-9">[9]</a></sup><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 10" class="reference" id="_ref-10"><a href="#_note-10">[10]</a></sup> When you begin to plan your birthday party, you want to start thinking of who you’d like to invite and how many people will be your limit.

<ul>
<li>Don’t feel obligated to invite people you don’t know very well. You want to feel comfortable, and it’s okay to only invite your close friends to your party.</li>
<li>Sometimes fewer people is better. Think about the amount of space you have and how many people can comfortably fit. Also, take into account whether you’ll be driving anywhere and whether or not you want to have a sleepover.</li>
<li>Anywhere between 5 and 15 people is normal for a teenage birthday party, but the number is ultimately up to you. You might only be comfortable with having your two best friends over, or you might have 20 people you really want to invite. Ask your parents what they are comfortable accommodating.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-7.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-7.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-7.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-7.jpg" height="546" id="img_fdf4ce5a8f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_fdf4ce5a8f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 7" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-7.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-7.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pick a length of time for your party.</b> Giving your party a time helps your guests know what to expect. Also, how long the party will last will determine how much food you need and how many guests you want to invite.

<ul>
<li>Try to have your party on a weekend so that more people will be able to come. If your party is a sleepover, think about when you want your guests to arrive and when you’d like them to leave the next day.</li>
<li>Consider your activities. For example, if you want to have a bonfire, you want your party to occur in the evening when it’s getting dark.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-8.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-8.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-8.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-8.jpg" height="546" id="img_191f4e0e34" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_191f4e0e34')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 8" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-8.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-8.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Pick a party theme.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 11" class="reference" id="_ref-11"><a href="#_note-11">[11]</a></sup> Having a theme can help you plan your invitations, decorations, and food. For a winter party, your theme might just be a winter wonderland. You could plan to decorate with snowflakes and have cozy, comfort foods. Other possible wintertime themes could be:

<ul>
<li>A camping and bonfire theme</li>
<li>A movie-based theme (e.g. Harry Potter)</li>
<li>A combined birthday and holiday party</li>
<li>A sports watching party (e.g. hockey)</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-9.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-9.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-9.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-9.jpg" height="546" id="img_13b941f65c" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_13b941f65c')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 9" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c8/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-9.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-9.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make and send party invitations.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 12" class="reference" id="_ref-12"><a href="#_note-12">[12]</a></sup> Invitations are fun way to make your party feel more special and build the anticipation. You can use programs like Microsoft Word or PowerPoint to make your own invitations, hand write your invitations, or buy premade invitations.

<ul>
<li>Either mail your invitations, or give them to your friends in person.</li>
<li>Make sure the invitations include the date and time of the party, the location of the party, and how the guest can RSVP. Also include if the guests needs to bring anything. For example, if it’s a sleepover, let them know if they should bring a blanket or pillow.</li>
<li>If you don’t want to send physical invitations, you can use Facebook to make an event for your party.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 13" class="reference" id="_ref-13"><a href="#_note-13">[13]</a></sup> All your friends can RSVP through the event page and ask you questions about the party.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-10.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-10.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-10.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-10.jpg" height="546" id="img_98990490d9" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_98990490d9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 10" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-10.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-10.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 5" class="step_num">5</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_2_5"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Decorate for your winter birthday party.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 14" class="reference" id="_ref-14"><a href="#_note-14">[14]</a></sup> Even if you don’t want to go all out, a little bit of decoration can make your party feel festive and thought-out.

<ul>
<li>Pick a few colors to based your decorations around. For example, if your party has a seasonal winter theme, silver, white, and blue are good colors to decorate with.</li>
<li>Get a tablecloth for the table you’ll put food on, and get some balloons for the main party room. You can also add streamers or tinsel.</li>
<li>Make a birthday banner with some ribbon, cardstock, and a marker.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 15" class="reference" id="_ref-15"><a href="#_note-15">[15]</a></sup>
</li>
<li>Before the party, it can be fun to invite over one or two of your close friends to help you decorate and set up.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>

<a class="anchor" name="Making_Winter_Party_Food_sub"></a><div class="section steps sticky">
<h3>
<div class="altblock"><label class="method_label">Method</label> <span>3</span>
</div>
<span class="mw-headline" id="Making_Winter_Party_Food">Making Winter Party Food</span>
</h3>
<div class="section_text" id="steps_3">
<ol class="steps_list_2">
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-11.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-11.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-11.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-11.jpg" height="546" id="img_4d487e176d" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_4d487e176d')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 11" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-11.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-11.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 1" class="step_num">1</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_1"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Serve warm drinks.</b> A winter party is the ideal time to have warm comfort foods and drinks. Hot chocolate can be a great winter party beverage that most people enjoy.

<ul>
<li>To make it more festive, have a hot chocolate bar.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 16" class="reference" id="_ref-16"><a href="#_note-16">[16]</a></sup> On a table, set up hot chocolate with plenty of toppings for your guests to choose from. You can have whipped cream, chocolate chips, sprinkles, crushed cookies, and peppermint stirring sticks.</li>
<li>In addition to hot chocolate, you can also serve warm apple cider. Set your drinks out with an assortment of mugs for your guests to choose from.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-12.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-12.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-12.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-12.jpg" height="546" id="img_c31ea16aa6" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_c31ea16aa6')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 12" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-12.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-12.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 2" class="step_num">2</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_2"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Make finger foods.</b><sup aria-label="Link to Reference 17" class="reference" id="_ref-17"><a href="#_note-17">[17]</a></sup> Whether or not your party falls around a meal time, it’s good to have snack types foods.

<ul>
<li>Pizza is a great finger food that can be a meal or a snack. You can also serve breadsticks or pizza dough pretzels in addition.</li>
<li>Serve different kinds of dips, like onion dip or hummus, with chips and pretzels.</li>
<li>For a healthier snack, set out cut fruit and vegetables on a platter.</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-13.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-13.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-13.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-13.jpg" height="546" id="img_7a70d84a6f" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_7a70d84a6f')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 13" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-13.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-13.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 3" class="step_num">3</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_3"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Create a buildable dish.</b> This allows your guests with various dietary preferences or allergies to all find something that they like. For example, nachos are a great party dish. You can serve all the topping in bowls along a table, and allow your guests to build their own. Other dishes like this include:

<ul>
<li>Salads</li>
<li>Sandwiches</li>
<li>Burgers and vegetable burgers</li>
<li>Rice bowls</li>
<li>Tacos</li>
<li>Personal pizza</li>
<li>Spaghetti</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
<li class="hasimage final_li">
<div class="mwimg largeimage floatcenter" style="max-width:728px"><a class="image lightbox" data-href="/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-14.jpg?ajax=true&aid=2615761" href="#/Image:Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-(For-Teens)-Step-14.jpg"><div class="content-spacer">
<img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" data-src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-14.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-14.jpg" height="546" id="img_3a5b5cebb9" width="728"/><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('img_3a5b5cebb9')</script>
</div>
<noscript><img alt="Image titled Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens) Step 14" class="whcdn content-fill" height="546" src="https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-14.jpg/aid2615761-v4-728px-Plan-a-Winter-Birthday-Party-%28For-Teens%29-Step-14.jpg" width="728"/></noscript></a></div>
<div aria-label="Step 4" class="step_num">4</div>
<a class="stepanchor" name="step_3_4"></a><div class="step">
<b class="whb">Consider the cake.</b> For your birthday, you’ll want to have some type of sweet confection to celebrate with. You can go with a traditional decorated cake or cupcakes, or you can choose another type of dessert.<sup aria-label="Link to Reference 18" class="reference" id="_ref-18"><a href="#_note-18">[18]</a></sup> Some alternatives to traditional cake include:

<ul>
<li>Cheesecake</li>
<li>Ice cream cake</li>
<li>A cake made from donuts</li>
<li>A cookie cake or platter</li>
<li>Pie</li>
<li>Brownies</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</li>
</ol>
<div class="clearall"></div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">What if there's only 2 people who can come to my birthday party can we still have fun?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Of course! Plan some activities that are fun for just a few people, maybe watch one of your favorite movies, or play a card or board game that you like. These activities are actually more difficult with a bigger group.</div>
<div class="qa_answer_footer">
<div class="wh_vote_container qa_vote_buttons">

</li>
<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="328294" data-caid="329167" data-cqid="328311" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1379319" data-submitter_id="4481885" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="5">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do I convince my parents to let me have a party if my birthday is in between Christmas and New Year's Eve? They think that no one will come.</div>
<div class="qa_answers">
<div class="qa_user_area">
<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle" style="background-image:url(https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-s-fYKtNgc4o/AAAAAAAAAAI/AAAAAAAAABU/5QviUXz3lQ4/s96-c/photo.jpg)"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"><span class="qa_user_link" data-href="/User:Jonah-Hamman">Jonah Hamman</span></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Have guests RSVP as means of proof. You can also talk to friends to see if they will be in town.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="397312" data-caid="398185" data-cqid="397329" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="1264782" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="4">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">How many people are a good amount to have for a murder mystery party? </div>

<div class="qa_answer answer">Around 7 including you. You don't want too many people to come because that could be overwhelming.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="360817" data-caid="361690" data-cqid="360834" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2120252" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="5" data-votes_up="4">
<div class="qa_divider"></div>
<div class="qa_li_container">
<div class="qa_question_tab">Question</div>
<div class="qa_q_txt question">I'm 17 and my birthday is in the middle of winter. I've done everything in the book. Any ideas? I'm planning a slumber party, but I want to do something fun.</div>

<div class="qa_user_area">

<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="qa_answer answer">Maybe you could book a hotel suite for your birthday and everyone could go swimming in the indoor pool. You could also order pizza and watch movies and/or play board games.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="382647" data-caid="383520" data-cqid="382664" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2235090" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="6" data-votes_up="4">

<div class="qa_q_txt question">How do you tell your guests that you have to change your plans?</div>
<div class="qa_answers">

<div class="qa_user_hover hint_box"></div>
<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>
<div class="qa_user_label">Community Answer</div>

<div class="qa_answer answer">Tell them you're very sorry that you can't do it, but arrange  to meet up with them soon. Don't tell them via text, though.</div>

<li class="qa_aq qa_block" data-aqid="525639" data-caid="526512" data-cqid="525656" data-qa_inactive="0" data-sqid="2703597" data-submitter_id="0" data-verifier_id="0" data-votes_down="2" data-votes_up="1">

<div class="qa_badge"></div>
<div class="qa_person_circle"></div>
<div class="qa_answerer_info">
<div class="qa_user_name"></div>

    "step": [
        {
            "@type": "HowToSection",
            "name": "Planning Fun Winter Birthday Party Activities",
            "position": 1,
            "itemListElement": [
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 1,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Choose a venue.[1] Unless you\u2019re having your entire party at home, you\u2019ll want to have a great winter-friendly place to celebrate. Depending upon where you live, you have a variety of options for places to host your birthday party. When choosing your venue, keep your budget and number of party guests in mind. Possible winter party venues include:\n\nA bowling alley\nAn arcade\nA restaurant\nA movie theatre\nA dance studio\nAn indoor pool\nA studio with classes (e.g. ceramics painting or dancing)\nAn indoor or outdoor ice-skating rink\nA local museum that hosts parties"
                    }
                },
                {
                    "@type": "HowToStep",
                    "position": 2,
                    "itemListElement": {
                        "@type": "HowToDirection",
                        "position": 1,
                        "text": "Plan activities based around your party theme.[2] A great way to get inspiration for winter birthday party activities is to think first about what you want your theme to be. Then, you can think of activities that go well with your theme. Some examples of themes with corresponding activities include:\n\n\u201cArt Party\u201d: Create drawings, paintings, and sculptures. You can even host a contest, choose judges, and have small prizes for the winners. title: How to Plan a Winter Birthday Party (For Teens)
content_html:
Choose a venue.[1] Unless you’re having your entire party at home, you’ll want to have a great winter-friendly place to celebrate. Depending upon where you live, you have a variety of options for places to host your birthday party. When choosing your venue, keep your budget and number of party guests in mind. Possible winter party venues include:
  • A bowling alley
  • An arcade
  • A restaurant
  • A movie theatre
  • A dance studio
  • An indoor pool
  • A studio with classes (e.g. ceramics painting or dancing)
  • An indoor or outdoor ice-skating rink
  • A local museum that hosts parties
Plan activities based around your party theme.[2] A great way to get inspiration for winter birthday party activities is to think first about what you want your theme to be. Then, you can think of activities that go well with your theme. Some examples of themes with corresponding activities include:
  • “Art Party”: Create drawings, paintings, and sculptures. You can even host a contest, choose judges, and have small prizes for the winners. Consider also making something the party guest will use, like a painted tote bag or t-shirt.
  • “Nostalgic Disney Party”: Every one loves remember their favorite classic Disney movies. Play Disney Scene It! and trivia, and marathon watch old Disney movies.
  • “Winter Wonderland”: If you live somewhere snowy, take advantage of it. Go sledding and have a snowman-building contest. You can even try to build a fort from snow. Just make sure all your guests bring their snow gear.
  • “Baking Party”: Use premade cakes or cookies, and let everyone decorate their own with icing, fondant, and sprinkles. Watch shows like Cake Boss to inspire your sweet creations.
  • “Dance Competition”: Put on some music, and see who can come up with the best moves. Play dancing games on your Xbox or Wii, if you have one, to make it a bit more structured. Watch and comment on dancing shows like Dance Moms, So You Think You Can Dance, or Dancing with the Stars, when you get tired of dancing yourself.
  • “Indoor Scavenger Hunt”: Scavenger hunts are fun and versatile. Make clues in advance and hide them around the party venue. Break guests up into teams. See who can follow the clues to the hidden prize first.
  • “Dreaming of Summer”: Having a sunny indoor party when it’s cold and gray can be a lot of fun. Have beach chairs for your guests to sit on, and let everyone wear flower necklaces. Play summery music, like Jimmy Buffet or the Beach Boys. Turn up the heat, and tell everyone to bring beach clothes. Watch a classic surf movie.
  • “Spa Party”: Throw a spa party, and pamper all your guests. Do each other’s nails and hair. Make homemade face masks.[3] Light scented candle. Give everyone a gift bag with make up or a sleep mask.
  • “Murder Mystery”: Having a murder mystery party can be a great way to make your entire party into a game.[4] You can buy a premade game, download a free one, or make up your own. Give all your guests a character, and send them a small description of that character before the party. Tell them to dress up like the character. Throughout the party, as your characters, you and your guests will have to ask each other questions to determine who the murderer is.
Create a bonfire party. Having a roaring fire is a great way to have an outdoor party even during winter. Pick a spot in your backyard to have your fire, and set up camp chairs around it for your guests. You can roast marshmallows and hot dogs in the fire.
  • Keep safety in mind.[5] After you build your fire, make sure your have sand and water on hand to put it out once the party is over.
  • Keep a stack of wood handy to stoke the fire during the party.
  • Provide blankets. Even though you’ll have a fire, it can be nice to have a bunch of wool blankets on hand to keep your guests comfortable. If you don’t have enough blankets, ask the party guests to bring their own.
  • If you know someone who plays guitar, ask them to bring their guitar so they can play songs around the fire.
Create your own cinema.[6] No matter the theme of your party, you can always find a related movie or TV show to watch. This gives everyone a chance to relax. Creating a cinema experience makes watching a movie feel more like a party.
  • Hang up a white sheet on an empty wall. Borrow a projector to project a movie up onto the sheet, as an inexpensive movie screen. Cozy up the movie area with lots of pillows and blankets. If you live in an area with mild winters, you can even have an outdoor movie, complete with lots of blankets and maybe even a campfire.
  • Make popcorn, and serve boxed candy, just like the movie theatre. Let everyone know what movie you’re showing when you invite them to the party.
  • Have a marathon. Consider making a night of it, and watching all the movies in a series.
Play board games.[7] Board games are a great option for any home party. They are inexpensive, and provide hours of entertainment. You can even have prizes for the winners.
  • Play classic board games like Monopoly, Sorry, Life or Risk.
  • Choose more interactive, creative board games like Balderdash or Cranium.
  • When choosing board games, make sure you choose games that all your guests can play at once, or have different game stations.
  • Consider also playing party games like Never Have I Ever, Musical Chairs, Charades, or Two Truths and a Lie along with your board games. Many games like this also have board game versions.[8]
Decide how many people to invite.[9][10] When you begin to plan your birthday party, you want to start thinking of who you’d like to invite and how many people will be your limit.
  • Don’t feel obligated to invite people you don’t know very well. You want to feel comfortable, and it’s okay to only invite your close friends to your party.
  • Sometimes fewer people is better. Think about the amount of space you have and how many people can comfortably fit. Also, take into account whether you’ll be driving anywhere and whether or not you want to have a sleepover.
  • Anywhere between 5 and 15 people is normal for a teenage birthday party, but the number is ultimately up to you. You might only be comfortable with having your two best friends over, or you might have 20 people you really want to invite. Ask your parents what they are comfortable accommodating.
Pick a length of time for your party. Giving your party a time helps your guests know what to expect. Also, how long the party will last will determine how much food you need and how many guests you want to invite.
  • Try to have your party on a weekend so that more people will be able to come. If your party is a sleepover, think about when you want your guests to arrive and when you’d like them to leave the next day.
  • Consider your activities. For example, if you want to have a bonfire, you want your party to occur in the evening when it’s getting dark.
Pick a party theme.[11] Having a theme can help you plan your invitations, decorations, and food. For a winter party, your theme might just be a winter wonderland. You could plan to decorate with snowflakes and have cozy, comfort foods. Other possible wintertime themes could be:
  • A camping and bonfire theme
  • A movie-based theme (e.g. Harry Potter)
  • A combined birthday and holiday party
  • A sports watching party (e.g. hockey)
Make and send party invitations.[12] Invitations are fun way to make your party feel more special and build the anticipation. You can use programs like Microsoft Word or PowerPoint to make your own invitations, hand write your invitations, or buy premade invitations.
  • Either mail your invitations, or give them to your friends in person.
  • Make sure the invitations include the date and time of the party, the location of the party, and how the guest can RSVP. Also include if the guests needs to bring anything. For example, if it’s a sleepover, let them know if they should bring a blanket or pillow.
  • If you don’t want to send physical invitations, you can use Facebook to make an event for your party.[13] All your friends can RSVP through the event page and ask you questions about the party.
Decorate for your winter birthday party.[14] Even if you don’t want to go all out, a little bit of decoration can make your party feel festive and thought-out.
  • Pick a few colors to based your decorations around. For example, if your party has a seasonal winter theme, silver, white, and blue are good colors to decorate with.
  • Get a tablecloth for the table you’ll put food on, and get some balloons for the main party room. You can also add streamers or tinsel.
  • Make a birthday banner with some ribbon, cardstock, and a marker.[15]
  • Before the party, it can be fun to invite over one or two of your close friends to help you decorate and set up.
Serve warm drinks. A winter party is the ideal time to have warm comfort foods and drinks. Hot chocolate can be a great winter party beverage that most people enjoy.
  • To make it more festive, have a hot chocolate bar.[16] On a table, set up hot chocolate with plenty of toppings for your guests to choose from. You can have whipped cream, chocolate chips, sprinkles, crushed cookies, and peppermint stirring sticks.
  • In addition to hot chocolate, you can also serve warm apple cider. Set your drinks out with an assortment of mugs for your guests to choose from.
Make finger foods.[17] Whether or not your party falls around a meal time, it’s good to have snack types foods.
  • Pizza is a great finger food that can be a meal or a snack. You can also serve breadsticks or pizza dough pretzels in addition.
  • Serve different kinds of dips, like onion dip or hummus, with chips and pretzels.
  • For a healthier snack, set out cut fruit and vegetables on a platter.
Create a buildable dish. This allows your guests with various dietary preferences or allergies to all find something that they like. For example, nachos are a great party dish. You can serve all the topping in bowls along a table, and allow your guests to build their own. Other dishes like this include:
  • Salads
  • Sandwiches
  • Burgers and vegetable burgers
  • Rice bowls
  • Tacos
  • Personal pizza
  • Spaghetti
Consider the cake. For your birthday, you’ll want to have some type of sweet confection to celebrate with. You can go with a traditional decorated cake or cupcakes, or you can choose another type of dessert.[18] Some alternatives to traditional cake include:
  • Cheesecake
  • Ice cream cake
  • A cake made from donuts
  • A cookie cake or platter
  • Pie
  • Brownies
